title: [Large-Scale] Social Learning Community-Based Instructional Design for Online Learning Transition Competency Enhancement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience using online learning platforms, foundational understanding of curriculum design, and general knowledge of social studies content (history, geography, culture, etc.)
context.additional_context: Provides simulation- and VR-based practical training to help pre-service/in-service teachers effectively respond to post-pandemic online learning environments. Strengthens peer learning and collaboration through social learning community activities. Emphasizes developing online pedagogical methods tailored to social studies subjects (historical inquiry, geographical analysis, cultural comparison).

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more social learning design principles for transitioning to online learning (citizen engagement, collaborative learning, cultural diversity considerations, etc.).
Learners can design and execute one or more online class scenarios (historical exploration, virtual social problem-solving, etc.) using VR-based simulations.
Learners contribute to civic engagement by providing and incorporating peer feedback at least three times using community collaboration tools (forums, wikis, etc.).
Learners can apply five or more strategies to promote learner engagement in online environments, such as facilitating discussions, utilizing role-playing, and connecting with the local community.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
